required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Lotrafilcon B Lenses With Different Packaging Solutions
clinical_study.official_title: One Month Clinical Comparison of Two Lotrafilcon B Spherical Lenses With Different Packaging Solutions

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate AIR OPTIX® plus HYDRAGLYDE® (AOHG) contact lenses compared to AIR OPTIX® AQUA (AOA) contact lenses in overall lens fit.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects must not wear any contact lenses prior to the visit on Day 1 (Insertion) for Period 1 or Day 1 (Insertion) for Period 2.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Satisfying the "no Re-fit" Criteria in Both Eyes
primary_outcome.description: Overall lens fit was graded by the Investigator on a 5-point scale: -2 (unacceptably tight); -1 (acceptably tight); 0 (optimal fit); +1 (acceptable loose); +2 (unacceptable loose). 'No re-fit' criteria was satisfied if an acceptable or optimal overall lens fit, that was also within one grade of the habitual lens fit value, was achieved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Ex Vivo Total Cholesterol Uptake After 30 Days of Wear
secondary_outcome.description: The contact lens was removed from the eye. Cholesterol deposits were extracted and measured in micrograms (μg) per lens. Lower deposits indicate increased lens performance. Only one eye (right eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Insertion in Minimum Protected Area (MPA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hour 0 (Lens Insertion) to Hour 12 on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: MPA (the minimum area of the contact lens surface (expressed in %) protected by the tear film between two natural blinks) was assessed by the Investigator during the interblink period using the Tearscope® lighting system. Higher values indicate a more stable tear film in front of the lens. This Outcome Measure was pre-specified for AOHG only. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.

arm_group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 worn first, followed by lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn second. Both products worn bilaterally (in both eyes) for 30 days and removed nightly for care using a hydrogen peroxide-based lens care solution.

Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn first, followed by lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 worn second. Both products worn bilaterally for 30 days and removed nightly for care using a hydrogen peroxide-based lens care solution.

intervention.intervention_name: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41
intervention.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses packaged with copolymer 845 and EOBO-41
Lotrafilcon B contact lenses packaged with copolymer 845
Commercially-available hydrogen peroxide-based lens care solution for cleaning, disinfecting, and storing silicone hydrogel soft contact lenses

intervention.intervention_name: Saline solution for rinsing contact lenses
intervention.description: Commercially-available saline solution used as needed

intervention.intervention_name: Saline solution for rinsing contact lens case

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 1 study center located in the United Kingdom (UK).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 82 enrolled, 6 subjects were exited as screen failures prior to randomization. One subject withdrew consent after randomization, but before exposure to product. This reporting group includes all randomized and exposed subjects (75).

group.title: AOHG, Then AOA
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 worn first, followed by lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn second. Both products worn bilaterally (in both eyes) for 30 days and removed nightly for care using a hydrogen peroxide-based lens care solution.

group.title: AOA, Then AOHG
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn first, followed by lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 worn second. Both products worn bilaterally for 30 days and removed nightly for care using a hydrogen peroxide-based lens care solution.

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all randomized and exposed subjects (Full Analysis Set).

group.title: Overall
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 and lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn bilaterally during Period 1 and Period 2 in a crossover assignment, as randomized.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Satisfying the “no Re-fit” Criteria in Both Eyes
outcome.description: Overall lens fit was graded by the Investigator on a 5-point scale: -2 (unacceptably tight); -1 (acceptably tight); 0 (optimal fit); +1 (acceptable loose); +2 (unacceptable loose). 'No re-fit' criteria was satisfied if an acceptable or optimal overall lens fit, that was also within one grade of the habitual lens fit value, was achieved.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set. Number Analyzed is the number of subjects with non-missing response.

group.title: AOHG Contact Lenses
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 worn bilaterally for 30 days in Period 1 or 2, as randomized

group.title: AOA Contact Lenses
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn bilaterally for 30 days in Period 1 or 2, as randomized

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects Satisfying the “no Re-fit” Criteria in Both Eyes
measure.description: Overall lens fit was graded by the Investigator on a 5-point scale: -2 (unacceptably tight); -1 (acceptably tight); 0 (optimal fit); +1 (acceptable loose); +2 (unacceptable loose). 'No re-fit' criteria was satisfied if an acceptable or optimal overall lens fit, that was also within one grade of the habitual lens fit value, was achieved.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set. Number Analyzed is the number of subjects with non-missing response.

outcome.title: Mean Ex Vivo Total Cholesterol Uptake After 30 Days of Wear
outcome.description: The contact lens was removed from the eye. Cholesterol deposits were extracted and measured in micrograms (μg) per lens. Lower deposits indicate increased lens performance. Only one eye (right eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set. Only the right (OD) lenses were collected from a subset of subjects.

group.title: AOHG Contact Lenses
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 worn bilaterally for 30 days in Period 1 or 2, as randomized

group.title: AOA Contact Lenses
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn bilaterally for 30 days in Period 1 or 2, as randomized

measure.title: Mean Ex Vivo Total Cholesterol Uptake After 30 Days of Wear
measure.description: The contact lens was removed from the eye. Cholesterol deposits were extracted and measured in micrograms (μg) per lens. Lower deposits indicate increased lens performance. Only one eye (right eye) contributed to the analysis.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set. Only the right (OD) lenses were collected from a subset of subjects.

outcome.title: Change From Insertion in Minimum Protected Area (MPA)
outcome.description: MPA (the minimum area of the contact lens surface (expressed in %) protected by the tear film between two natural blinks) was assessed by the Investigator during the interblink period using the Tearscope® lighting system. Higher values indicate a more stable tear film in front of the lens. This Outcome Measure was pre-specified for AOHG only. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Hour 0 (Lens Insertion) to Hour 12 on Day 1
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set. Number Analyzed is the number of eyes with non-missing response.

group.title: AOHG Contact Lenses
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses with EOBO-41 worn bilaterally for 30 days in Period 1 or 2, as randomized

measure.title: Change From Insertion in Minimum Protected Area (MPA)
measure.description: MPA (the minimum area of the contact lens surface (expressed in %) protected by the tear film between two natural blinks) was assessed by the Investigator during the interblink period using the Tearscope® lighting system. Higher values indicate a more stable tear film in front of the lens. This Outcome Measure was pre-specified for AOHG only. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set. Number Analyzed is the number of eyes with non-missing response.
measure.units: percentage of contact lens surface area

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from time of consent for the duration of a subject’s participation in the study (up to 74 days). AEs are reported as pre-treatment and treatment-emergent.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs in subjects, users or other persons, whether or not related to the medical device.

group.title: Pretreatment
group.description: All subjects who consented to participate in the study prior to initiation of study treatment

group.title: AOHG Contact Lenses
group.description: All subjects exposed to AOHG contact lenses

group.title: AOA Contact Lenses
group.description: All subjects exposed to AOA contact lenses

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
